transcript:
twenty times repeated of a sonata by Dussek. 
Just then a closed carriage and another with a hood drove up to the porch. Prince Andrew got out of the carriage, helped his little wife to alight, and let her pass into the house before him. Old Tfkhon, wearing a wig, put his head out of the door of the antechamber, reported in a whisper that the prince was sleeping, and hastily closed the door. Tfkhon knew that nei- ther the son's arrival nor any other unusual event must be allowed to disturb
